Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of rejection of refugee claim based on property rights
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) sections 96 and 97
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Abandonment of property rights to avoid persecution
Proceeding_Type: Judicial review with certification of a question of general importance
Regulation_Cited: UN Convention relating to the Status of Refugees
Review_Outcome: Dismissed, but serious question certified for appeal
Assessment_Standard: Objective analysis of risk under IRPA
Legal_Standard: Interpretation of refugee protection under IRPA and UN Convention
Application_Factor: Personal risk of torture or death under section 97
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether rejection based on property rights was reasonable
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA section 96: no refugee status for property rights claims; IRPA section 97: risk of torture or death
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of persecution based on race or fundamental rights
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of decision under IRPA
Procedural_Issue: Certification of question of general importance
Omission_Type: Failure to explicitly analyze section 97 risk
